title: [Large-scale] Analysis of Adoption Factors and Strategy Development for Virtual Grocery Shopping (VGS)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding consumer behavior theory, technology acceptance model (TAM), and basic statistical analysis
context.additional_context: Exploring VGS diffusion strategies through consumer learning optimization in digital device-enabled environments

learning_goals: Learners can design a model analyzing the impact of consumer technology readiness, convenience motivation, and perceived ease of use (PEOU) on VGS adoption intentions.
Learners can perform cluster analysis on Canadian consumer data to identify four consumer segments and propose marketing strategies based on their characteristics.
Learners can establish an experimental design to validate the influence of consumer learning optimization factors on VGS adoption using structural equation modeling (SEM).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
